phrases: It will not take long.
Be patient.
How did I get here?
Elias was telling me about the dragons, and...
Dragons?
Yes, dragons.
They have been on the move lately.
I have been asked to check it out.
Here, in Iceland, is the dragons' nest.
They are on the verge of extinction, just like us mages.
The handful of surviving breeds have been rounded up here to be taken care of.
It is remote and scarcely inhabited here, which makes it a perfect hiding space.
Are they vicious?
The majority of them were weeded out long ago.
There are more docile ones now.
I see.
Chise!
Elias!
His half-baked talent makes him cocky.
He has not changed much.
See, look over there.
The last land of the dragons.
Hey, let her go.
Hey!
Does she plan to just keep sinking?
My body feels heavy.
Chise.
Chise.
Chise.
Well.
What an unusual guest.
You smell like a mage...
albeit a young one.
A sapling.
And you smell of plants, flowers, and rocks from another place.
It is a nice scent.
His eyes...
His whole body is like a forest of moss, too.
He is a breed of dragon called an uil.
He is both father and the mother to the forest, bearing vegetation on his decaying body.
Apologies for the rough handling.
Why me?
There was commotion among the ariels.
They said that Thorn had finally taken an apprentice.
For them, rumors spread literally like the wind.
You arrived quite quickly this time around.
When are you going to stop hiding in your apprentice's shadows, Thorn?
Or rather, Ainsworth?
When the old fogey finishes his bumbling.
It is been 300 years, and you still have not stopped toying with people, have you, Echos?
Do you want your apprentice to freeze to death, Ainsworth?
I am... I am fine.
You are absolutely soaked.
Nettles in the shadow...
Ring of holly...
I am dry.
Th-Thank you.
What are you grinning at?
At this little brat acting like he is all grown up.
Shut it.
Chise, that is Lindel.
He is a mage, like me, and caretaker of this dragon's nest.
Caretaker?
His duty is to keep the land of dragons hidden from the sight of ordinary humans.
Hence, caretaker.
Despite his appearance, he is a mischievous senior, even more ancient than I am,
so be careful around him.
How dare you...
Hey, hey!
Are you done talking?
Let us play.
Let us play!
Let us play!
Come on.
Those are dragon hatchlings.
Let us play.
Let us play!
Please?
The one with wings is a gwee.
Come on!
The one by your feet is a beana.
Come on, let us play!
The slow-moving one is an uil.
Granted, that is just what I call them personally.
Let us play!
Come on!
Hey, are you listening?
Lindel.
Let us play!
Tell me, has there been any trouble lately?
They are making a fuss again, are they?
Food has been scarce this year.
A number of the dragons have been traveling far.
Chise, would you mind playing with them for me?
What should we do?
Over there.
Let us jump off and practice gliding toward the pond.
Humans can fly these days, right?
Er, that might be hard without having my bones and muscles modified at the genetic level.
Yay!
And now I am wet again.
Hey, can we try that?
That was awesome!
He has wings, so I guess he must be able to fly.
He is all tattered, though.
Have you never seen a dragon before?
S-Sorry, I did not mean to...
I did not mean it like that.
Uncle Nevin's awake.
It is will not be long before I return home.
I would supposed you would prefer to watch over the rollicking young instead.
It is almost his time.
His time?
Uncle Nevin's turning into a tree soon.
Yup.
All the uils do.
They turn into excellent trees and pasture.
When you say return...
What do you mean?
We are going to turn into trees and moss and boulders when we die, too.
Right?
When you die?
We do not fear death the way you humans do.
We live our lives to the fullest, so that we are never left with regrets.
Does not it hurt?
You are a kind-hearted child.
We understand that what is given to us is the same
as what is given to all who live on this planet.
Whether that is the joy or the pain of living, or the sadness or loneliness of dying.
Besides, I have lived for more than enough time.
For a long, long time, even for a dragon.
Life will be handed down to the next generation.
You have no reason to grieve.
No.
I am not grieving.
I cannot.
It is really...
The living should not envy the dead.
You cannot fly, so it is fortunate that you did not.
He would not have known who to take as his apprentice if he had not met you.
Were you going through my memories?
That was a disrespectful thing to do to a human.
I am sorry.
I believe I ought to let you experience the joy of true flight, as you cannot fly yourself.
I do not have the strength to fly anymore,
but I can show you the sky I see in my mind.
Behold.
Looks like Nevin is having his final dream, along with Chise.
A lot of dragons are passing the torch lately.
I suppose he is the last of the old dragons.
It is the same for dragons as it is for magic, is not it?
We are being pushed aside by the changing times and the growing number of humans.
If Chise becomes a mage, she may very well be of the last generation.
Does that bother you?
Chise's power is flowing into Nevin.
She will be a great help to Nevin,
but a Sleigh Beggy's overwhelming power, at times, hurts its wielder.
She does not know how to hold back yet.
Is not it your job to teach her?
She will not last three years unless you stop her.
I know.
Do not let her out of your sight.
There are countless people who want a Sleigh Beggy.
The rumors these days are not encouraging.
She was not easy to obtain.
I will not let her go that easily.
I hope she grows up safely...
That Sleigh Beggy.
Our kind abandoned the skies.
But it was always our fate to dwell beneath it.
Your name has the character for bird within it.
You must also fly beneath this sky, in order to live.
In order to live?
Fly?
In order to live...
It is a tree.
Thank you.
Because you were here, I spent my last moments in flight.
I did not do anything.
A little while ago, Lindel planted a small seed in my body.
It will produce beautiful white flowers, I am told.
You are a mage, are you not?
You will need a wand, someday.
Make one out of my branches.
Good night, little mage.
Uncle was awesome.
Was not he?
I hope I can become a huge tree, too.
Was it beautiful in Nevin's sky?
It was very beautiful.
That was a rare thing you got to witness.
Not many get to witness a dragon return to the earth.
Lindenbaum.
Its beautiful white flowers are in bloom.
There is not a single reason to be sad, Chise.
This is the work of nature.
The dragons all spend enormous time strengthening their minds,
and in the end, are at peace with becoming seedbeds for other life.
Okay.
Like Nevin said,
we will return for a branch to use for your wand, once it is time for you to have one.
Our business here is done for now.
Let us head home.
What?
Leaving so soon?
This is not the only matter I have had shoved at me.
You could just bail on it.
You are surprisingly proper, are not you?
Shut up.
This is nature...
Let us go, Chise.
I am not sad.
He was just like a stranger who happened to show me some kindness.
My head's spinning.
Is it because of the flight?
But still,
I cannot help but be a little envious
of the peaceful way he passed.
Past the tunnel was a nation of cats.
There, in a land drowning in sadness,
the girl learns of her own cruel duty.
Please, help us.
Help me.
